intro: Anisomeris protracta, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant has a deep taproot system, allowing it to survive in arid environments with minimal water. Its leaves are typically narrow and linear, reducing water loss through transpiration. Anisomeris protracta is a member of the Agavaceae family, which includes other succulent plants adapted to dry climates.
